content: Investigating potential areas for improvement after an incident has occurred is a standard practice in many industries, including the aviation industry, as it provides valuable insight and lessons learned that can inform changes to improve safety and prevent similar incidents from happening in the future. However, proactive measures are also taken to minimize risks and prevent incidents from occurring, even if the risks are accepted. This can include regular safety audits, assessments of new technologies, and collaboration with industry partners to identify and address emerging threats.
